required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Radical Prostatectomy Performed by Robot-assisted Laparoscopy or Conventional Laparoscopy or by Laparotomy
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Radical Prostatectomy for the Treatment of Prostate Cancer, Performed by Robot-assisted or Standard Laparoscopy or by Laparotomy : a Multicentric Prospective Study.

brief_summary.textblock: Minimally invasive surgery has developed widely since the 1980s and has revolutionized the practices of surgeons. In urology, the development of laparoscopy and then robot-assisted surgery has considerably improved the management of pathologies. In France, as in all the countries concerned, the spread of robotic surgery has taken place without prior studies validating this new technology, nor organizational rules in terms of quality and access to care. The report of the Haute Autorité de Santé dated November 2016 underlines the weakness of the methodological quality of studies and meta-analyzes evaluating robot-assisted total prostatectomy compared to other surgical techniques by laparotomy or conventional laparoscopy. It therefore appears important to evaluate in a large study the interest of this technique in order to help the authorities to decide on the real benefit of this technology and to provide reliable answers to the patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Minimally invasive surgery has developed widely since the 1980s and has revolutionized the practices of surgeons. In urology, the development of laparoscopy and then robot-assisted surgery has considerably improved the management of pathologies. In France, as in all the countries concerned, the spread of robotic surgery has taken place without prior studies validating this new technology, nor organizational rules in terms of quality and access to care. The report of the Haute Autorité de Santé dated November 2016 underlines the weakness of the methodological quality of studies and meta-analyzes evaluating robot-assisted total prostatectomy compared to other surgical techniques by laparotomy or conventional laparoscopy. It therefore appears important to evaluate in a large study the interest of this technique in order to help the authorities to decide on the real benefit of this technology and to provide reliable answers to the patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Impact of the prostatectomy procedure (robot assisted laparoscopy, conventional laparoscopy and surgical laparotomy) on the urinary function assessed by the EPIC 50 score
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of the prostatectomy performed by robot assisted laparoscopy or conventional laparoscopy and by surgical laparotomy on the urinary function assessed by the EPIC 50 score (Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite)

secondary_outcome.measure: impact of the robot assisted laparoscopy compared to conventional laparoscopy and by surgical laparotomy in radical prostatectomy on the erectile function assessed by the EPIC 50 score
secondary_outcome.description: impact of the robot assisted laparoscopy compared to conventional laparoscopy and by surgical laparotomy on the erectile function assessed by he EPIC 50 score (Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite)

secondary_outcome.measure: impact of the robot assisted laparoscopy in prostatectomy on the urinary function assessed by EPIC 50 SCORE
impact of the robot assisted laparoscopy in prostatectomy on the erectile function assessed by the International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF-5) score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: upt to 5 years after the surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the cost effectiveness of the robot assisted procedure in prostatectomy assessed by EQ5d-5L score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the cost effectiveness of the robot assisted procedure in prostatectomy assessed by EQ5d-5L score

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurence of prostatectomy sequelae (urinary incontinence or erectile dysfunction )
Occurence of prostatectomy sequelae (urinary incontinence or erectil dysfunction )

secondary_outcome.description: measures of the level of PSA in a man's blood

arm_group.description: radical prostatectomy performed by robot-assisted laparoscopy
radical prostatectomy performed by conventional laparoscopy

intervention.intervention_name: assessment of urinary function and erectil function before and after prostatectomy
intervention.description: assessment of urinary function and erectil function before and after prostatectomy performed by robot assisted or conventional laparoscopy or laparotomy will complete

study_pop.textblock: patient hospitalized for a planned radical prostactectomy .

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient hospitalized for a planned radical prostatectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Consent refusal from the patient
- Patients protected by law (Art.L 1121-5, 1121-6, 1121-8 du Code de la santé publique)
- Absence of a French Health Care Insurance coverage
